fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a review with 2 files in it.
2. Upon loading the review, the review comments are selected: click the next file icon.

Expected:
- You go to the first file in the actual review

Actual:
- You go to the first file in the actual review, but the previous file icon is disabled (when you should be able to click it to go back to the review comments).


The same problem exists when you click the next file icon until you hit the last file, then hit the previous file icon: the next file icon becomes disabled even though you should be able to go to the last file.

The open question is whether the previous file icon should be disabed when viewing the review comments, and whether the next file icon should be disabled when viewing the last file.
fields.summary: File navigation icons don't enable/disable properly

fields.description: opening user settings from the masthead doesn't close the drop down and it sits under the blanket
fields.summary: User menu still visible behind blanket of profile settings dialog

fields.description: with lots of repositories, the tooltip hover for commits by day hits the top of the canvas
fields.summary: Commits by day chart tooltip too tall

fields.description: I can POST the child before the parent has been POSTed. Rule: you cannot POST unless your parent is non-draft
fields.summary: You can post replies to draft comments

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Hover over the changset link for revision 94538 at https://svn.atlassian.com/atlaseye/changelog/bamboo/?showid=94538&view=fe

Expected:
- The changeset hover

Actual:
- Nothing -- the ajax request is fired, but won't return anytime soon, and you might end up with an unresponsive script warning when it tries to parse the result.

The particular changeset has 6000+ files modified. Maybe should provide the minimal details of the changeset then ajax load (into the dialog) the modified files (which won't fit nicely into the dialog, anyway).

Viewing the actual changeset https://svn.atlassian.com/atlaseye/changelog/bamboo/?cs=94538 takes ages anyway.
fields.summary: Changeset hover on massive commit doesn't return

fields.description:
Adding or deleting draft comments does not update the comment counts in the navigation tree and the review info pane.

Steps to reproduce (adding):
1. Create a new review.
2. Add a draft comment.

Expected
- The comment count for the file and review should update to 1.

Actual
- The comment counts stay at 0.


Steps to reproduce (deleting):
1. Create a new review.
2. Add a draft comment.
3. Reload the review.
4. Delete the draft comment.

Expected:
- After step 3, the comment count is 1, so step 4 should update it to 0.

Actual:
- Step 4 doesn't update the comment counts.
fields.summary: Draft comments aren't counted when dynamically updating comment counts

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a new review with some files in it (so that they'll have to be ajax loaded).
2. Add a draft general comment.
3. Reload the review page.

Exepected:
- After step 3, the initial total comment count should be 1.

Actual:
- After step 3, the initial total comment count is 0, but after the files finish ajax loading, the count becomes 1.
fields.summary: Total comment count on initial page load changes after ajax loads

fields.description:
As we do in the text rendering version of reviews, the UI should clip threads below a certain maximum threshold to prevent deeply nested discussion/flames from messing up the rendering.

The required implementation is discussed in:
https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-2310#c20128
fields.summary: Enforce maximum indent level for comment threads

fields.description:
Using the [File System SCM plugin|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/File+System+SCM+Plugin] in Crucible, the following issues occurred.
# The revision red line is not aligned 
# No "File View" and "Fisheye" drop down options
# The file status beside the file name always show "(updating)Added"
# See the attached screen shot

Steps to reproduce:
# Configure the [File System SCM plugin|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/File+System+SCM+Plugin]
# Create a review and add a file from File System SCM repository e.g config.xml in this case
# Make some changes to the file
# Go to "Review" tab to view the review
fields.summary: User interface is broken in a review when using File System SCM plugin

fields.description: "reviewer completedness" bar shows up green (complete) when first loading a review but after an update from the server changes red 5 seconds later.
fields.summary: Reviewers appear complete on initial load then update shortly after

fields.description:
The wiki preview button should be depressed when clicked.

It is currently not clear how to get back to 'edit' mode because of this.
fields.summary: Wiki preview button not depressed when active

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce for adding a user to a crowd group:
1. On atlaseye-qa, go to Admin > Users then click on a username to view their details.
2. Click 'Edit Groups'
3. Select an {{atlassian-}} prefixed group from the left pane and click 'Join >>'

Expected:
- The user is added to that group

Actual:
- Server 500s, e.g., "com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.DbException: Group 'atlassian-administration' does not exist"


Steps to reproduce for removing a user from a crowd group:
1. On atlaseye-qa, go to Admin > Users then click on a username to view their details.
2. Click 'Edit Groups'
3. Select an {{atlassian-}} prefixed group from the right pane and click '<< Leave'

Expected
- User is removed from the selected group

Actual
- Page reloads and the user is still a member of that group.
fields.summary: Adding/removing a user to a crowd group fails
Make Hibernate eagerly fetch comment threads

fields.description:
I've had two people indicate to me that they weren't aware of the full contents of the Review Objectives section.

The scrollbar is hard to see, and the default height of that pane is much smaller than the old one.

Please make the full contents more visible somehow (e.g. make the Review Objectives section larger).
fields.summary: review objectives section is too small

fields.description:
On my Crucible dashboard, the only way I can find to create a new review is to click Tools->Create New Review (Tools being the cog/gear icon in the top right of the page).

My Tools menu has no other entries, and this is a very common task for me.

There should be a way to create a new review in one click from the dashboard.
fields.summary: create new review shouldn't be hidden under the Tools menu

fields.description:
I created a review and uploaded a patch file.

I lost my hard drive over the weekend.

Now I'm trying to download the patch I attached to the review, and there doesn't seem to be any way.
fields.summary: download patch/uploaded file that's part of a review

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Navigate to Reviews -> Create Review -> Patches -> Upload a patch
2. Open that newly created review
3. Click on certain file
4. Change the 'Display Preferences' from 'Side-by-Side Diffs' to 'Unified Diffs' or vice versa

Notice that it needs to spend some time for the change to take effect. Sometime it spends me about 2 to 3 minutes just for 1 action to take effect. However, the changes under the 'File View' drop down list is much more faster. Please see the attached screenshot for a clearer picture: [DisplayPreference|^DisplayPreference.JPG], [FileView|^FileView.JPG]
fields.summary: Speed up the changes of 'Display Preferences'

fields.description:
If you include a changeset to a review, when viewing that changeset in Fisheye, it shows no associated reviews. It works fine in version 1.6.6.

See the following attachments:
In 1.6.6 works fine- [create review|^create-review-166.png] and [Fisheye view|^fisheye-view-166.png]
In 2.0.2 doesn't work - [Create review|^create-review-202.png] and [Fisheye view|^fisheye-view-202.png]

Steps to reproduce:
# Create a review and include one changeset in the review
# Go to Fisheye and view the changeset
fields.summary: Fisheye changeset view shows no associated review

fields.description:
If no default moderator is set, and then the user changes the moderator to someone other than themself, the "start review" button remains on the page, and if clicked results in state change error

Solution is to remove or disable the "start review" button accordingly when the moderator changes.
fields.summary: when the moderator changes, need to update the "start review" button accordingly.

fields.description:
Previously the instructions for  [Migrating FishEye Between Servers|http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/qAA0Cg] worked for both fisheye and crucible as all files were located in the FISHEYE_INST. 

However with the introduction of external databases for crucible, we need to update the docs for crucible. 

We need to supply a manually method (i.e. tell them what files to move over and to manually backup and restore their external db, edit the config.xml file, etc.) 

The other method would be using the [Crucible Backup and Restore|http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/VhayCg] and overriding the external db location using --dbtype and --jdbcurl etc.
fields.summary: Need to update the migrate Fisheye server instructions for crucible installs with external dbs

fields.description:
2009/8/6 Douglas Butler <dbutler@atlassian.com>:
> Hi Pete & Brendan,
>
> I hope this message finds you both well, if not stellar.  I wasn't sure who
> to direct this to so I'm spamming the both of you.
>
> I know that Crucible 2.1 is still in the planning stages, but was wondering
> if you think it likely that the ability to import/export individual Crucible
> projects and their associated reviews is going to make it in.
> This inquiry is on behalf of a customer who is looking at purchasing either
> 2 or 3 licenses of FishEye and Crucible.
fields.summary: ability to export/import individual Crucible projects (and all contained reviews)

fields.description:
At present, a URL like https://svn.atlassian.com/atlaseye/cru/defectreportimg?h=300&w=450&project=CR-JIRA&from=2009-05-06T21:03:09&to=2009-08-04T21:03:09&metric=classification&maxSegments=5&search.defects=true (i.e. one containing a project key which doesn't exist) returns a chart which seems to include all projects (? haven't verified this)

It should return an image containing an error message.
fields.summary: Correctly handle invalid project keys in chart URLs

fields.description:
The number of context lines shown for files in Crucible reviews should be sticky preferences.

Support case [CRC-887|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CRC-887]
fields.summary: Make context line counts sticky

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Dates are presented in the dd/MM/yyyy format.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the possibility to configure the dates in a different format (e.g. American format: MM dd yyyy).

We should also support locale specific time rendering, such as 24 hour time.
fields.summary: Localize date and time formatting

fields.description:
We are very frequently encountering the following error when Start Review is clicked:


-------------------------------------
error.unauthorized.stateChange

error.unauthorized.stateChange.description
Show details
Details:
The reported problem was:
You are running release CR2.0.2 FE2.0.2 (build-412 2009-07-24), please report your release number when reporting bugs.

Got a suggestion or an issue?
Discuss it in our forums or visit our support website for other options.

-------------------------------------



In the error logs, I can find all of the following happening regularly - I have been unable to determine which is related:


This one is logging at variable intervals but approximately every 5 to 10 minutes (I assume depending upon app usage):

fields.description:
In the Crucible database {{cru_stored_path.cru_path}} does not have unique constraint, but our code does assert that every path string exists only once, cause [StoredPathManager.findStoredPath()|https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/browse/FE/trunk/src/java/com/cenqua/crucible/model/managers/StoredPathManager.java?r=27989#l24] to throw a {{org.hibernate.NonUniqueResultException}} when it runs {{query.uniqueResult()}}:

fields.description:
I tried to create a review for RNDR-96, which using the "create review for all changesets" link.
It took me successfully to the "new review or add to one of these reviews" dialog.  (which, btw, is a little irritating when I've just said I want to create a review).
When I clicked the "create review" button it gave me an error message:

"You do not have permission to create reviews in project archive".

There was a "Reload" button but it didn't help.

I tried it a few times and always got that error.

I then created a review for just one of the changesets and it worked normally.
fields.summary: "project archive" permission error when adding review for two changesets from JIRA

fields.description:
Currently, the color of the reviewed files have their own meaning:

Bold text: unreviewed file
Red: deleted
Green: added
Blue: modified
Orange: copied

However, the copied file is displayed as green color. Please see the [screenshot|^fileColor.png]. Shouldn't it display as orange color?
fields.summary: The copied reviewed file should be shown in orange color
Poll server for completedness changes

fields.description:
If you upload the wrong patch, or a patch with an error in it, while you are creating the review, you can remove all the files from that patch from the review, but the patch itself stays there, still attached to the review, and is listed on the review page as one of the patches that are part of the review.  Unless I'm missing something, there is no way to delete the patch altogether.  See the following review:

https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-2296

It has 3 patches listed against it, all with the same filename, because after uploading and looking at the review I realised I had made a mistake, twice, so I reuploaded.  Only one of the patches has files in it that are being included in the review.  Which one is that?  It doesn't say.  If the functionality to delete patches were there, this wouldn't be a problem.
fields.summary: Allow patches to be removed from a review
Be able to set the default context when viewing the reviewed file
store frx diff and context settings in the review model

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Go to "Uploads" tab and upload a file using the "File to review" browser button
# Repeat the same action e.g upload the same file and click done
# You will see two revisions of the uploaded files
# Click on one of the older uploaded file shows the  _File Outdated_ tab and clicking on _Add Latest_ doesn't work. see the attached screen shot
fields.summary: File Outdated menu is shown when attaching files via the Uploads tab

fields.description:
Currently, the changes of the reviewed file will be shown in different color. For example: the file in red color represented the deleted file, green color represented the added file, blue color represented the modified file and etc

It would be good if there is a documentation about the color scheme of the reviewed file so that everyone can have a better understanding of the color scheme.
fields.summary: Documentation about the color scheme of the reviewed file

fields.description:
When creating a review e.g go to _Tools > Create Review > Files_ tab and select the file from a repository, however, the file link is broken. See these screen shots [file-tab.png|^file-tab.png] and [error-page.png|^error-page.png].

The link should be the same like in Fisheye repository view e.g see this [Fisheye-view.png|^Fisheye-view.png].
fields.summary: File link in the review is broken
Fix comment counts in nav tree
Printed nested comments in email template
Make necessary changes to REST

fields.description:
Comment from user:

{quote}
I would like to add an unrelated source code to an existing review.

Sometimes I'm not keen on creating fine-grained reviews for a single file or change set but for a sub-set of projects source code, e.g. found in separate Java packages. Here I would like to add new files to the review while I'm browsing through the source code.
{quote}

Currently, the file will only be added to the review if:
1. There is an existing review open that includes an older revision of the file
2. The commit has a crucible id in the commit message (e.g. CR-1), which is an open existing review

It would be better if the user can add the file directly into the review without having both of the condition above. My suggestion is to have 2 separate functionality which are 'Create Review' and 'Add to Review' so that the user can choose which review the file needs to add to.
fields.summary: Add a file directly to an existing review
Fix unwanted indenting in comment threads

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Commit a file as a username with capital letter (e.g. balint@DOMAIN)
2. The committer shown in Crucible will be displayed as balint@DOMAIN
3. Clicking the link of the username balint@DOMAIN will display the following message (http://localhost:8060/committer/MySVN/balint%40DOMAIN):

{noformat}
The requested resource cannot be found.
Committer balint@DOMAIN does not exist in repository MySVN

Referer:
    http://localhost:8060/committer/MySVN/balint%40domain 

You are running release CR2.0.2 FE2.0.2 (build-412 2009-07-24), please report your release number when reporting bugs.
Got a problem or a suggestion?

Discuss it in the online forums or visit the support website for your support options.
{noformat}

Please see the attached [screenshot|^screenshot.JPG] for a clearer picture. However, if I commit the file as username balint@domain, the committer will be shown as balint@domain in Crucible and there is no problem clicking on the username's link. 

By looking it further, in the user mapping page (_Administration -> User Mapping_), all the users in the 'Committer username' selection box are all shown in lowercase.
fields.summary: Case sensitivity in username

fields.description:
Currently, when configuring [JIRA servers|http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/mwtqCw] in Fisheye/Crucible, it doesn't use trusted application for getting information from Jira instead it uses the username/password account on the Jira instance.

Steps to reproduce:
# Assume that you have a user in Jira named "Test" who doesn't have permission to access to any issues in Jira
# Setup [JIRA servers|http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/mwtqCw] in Fisheye and specify the credential for user "Test" via _Admin > JIRA server_
# Setup trusted application. See the [FishEye documentation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Trusted+Applications] and [JIRA documentation|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.13.2/trusted_applications.html] on trusted applications. 
# Next, login Fisheye as a user who has permission to access the Jira issue e.g issue number MP-1 (in this case, this user should exists in both Jira and Fisheye)
# Create a review with a title named "MP-1"
# Mouseover the MP-1 link leads to the following error:
{noformat}
2009-07-28 13:50:31,671 DEBUG [btpool0-10] fisheye.app JiraIssueAjaxAction-execute - Error getting information for JIRA issue MP-1 from JIRA server Jira
com.cenqua.fisheye.util.LRUCache$ValueFactoryException: org.apache.xmlrpc.XmlRpcException: java.lang.Exception: com.atlassian.jira.rpc.exception.RemotePermissionException: This issue does not exist or you don't have permission to view it.
{noformat}

It would be good if the remote api supports trusted application to retrieve information from Jira.
fields.summary: Remote API should support trusted application to retrieve information from Jira
Disable delete for comments that have children

fields.description:
Notes from demo:

- add domain axis
- drop the revision histogram under the linecount
- should redo the calendar heat map to use Raphael
- click-thru for a given date
- Please test on SPM browsers (IE7+, FF3.5+, Safari3+)

stretch goals:
- sparklines on projects page to be redone in similar fashion
fields.summary: Replace sparklines & charts in dashboard with client-side rendered charts

fields.description:
In some cases, customers may want to create a backup of production and restore on a test server. 

If they are using an external db in their production server and do not specify a new db when restoring, they will drop their production database and recreate this using the backup. This means they will lose the data between the time the backup was restored till the current time, not to mention the unknown impact it will have on production server. 

We should have a big warning during production, saying "you will delete the database at location BLAH are you sure you absolutely want to do that? Please ensure you have a backup of that database if you are not sure.". We should provide this warning even if they override their db settings, just in case. 

Better yet we should force users to specify a database as it is too easy to override.
fields.summary: Warn before dropping database in restore

fields.description:
Both Joe and I were confident this would work:
1. ordered item
1. next item

It doesn't.

You need:
# ordered item
# next item

We need to develop a dialog based content area that outlines our acceptable wiki markup. Basically a clone of the one from JIRA here [https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=texteffects]

It would be like the Keyboard shortcut link in the Tools drop-down and work hand-in-hand with the preview
fields.summary: We need a cheat sheet for wiki markup that will work with the reviews

fields.description:
Currently, {{reviewUpdatedAjax}} calls are fired at a certain frequency regardless of whether previous calls successfully returned.

Erik has pointed out:
- if the server doesn't respond, we'll start firing off requests resembling a DoS
- calls may return out of order, leading to inconsistent results

Chaining would address both issues.
fields.summary: Review updated ajax calls should be chained

fields.description:
Crucible will not show the previous changes made prior the plugin setup. That means, you won't see the changeset the first time you have configured the plugin and you will see it after doing some changes in the Confluence page.

See the attached screen shot:
[Files tab|^Files-tab.PNG] -as you can see the Confluence pages listed
[Changsets tab|^changset.png] - the changes don't pick up

This is not reproducible in Crucible 2.0.2.
fields.summary: Crucible scm plugin doesn't pick up the old changes made in Confluence page
Implement collapsing of branches

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce 

1) Create a review for the file using a light SCM plugin 
2) Immediately after creating, when the file says "Updating" next to the file name, click on "edit revisions" and choose a previous revision.  
3) The chosen revision will not be added to the review, instead a new file (same filename) will be added with the chosen revision. 

If when adding the file to the review you wait for a few seconds, until the updating becomes "modified", then you can edit revisions and add a previous revision and it will be added to the existing file as expected.
fields.summary: When changing diff revision for light SCM plugins, new file is added rather than new revision being added to current revision

fields.description: It would be nice to let users control their avatars without relying on an external server.
fields.summary: let user have option to add avatar on profile page, without using a avatar server

I tried going to *Edit Review*, unchecking my name and hitting *Done* - the review reloaded but I am still a participant AFAICT.
fields.summary: Can't remove myself from a review
some css restyling needed

fields.description:
When someone adds you as a reviewer in a Crucible review, Crucible sends you an email invitation. If you've never used Crucible before, the experience is confusing. Basically, the subject line tells you that you have been "added as a reviewer". The title of the review and the statement of objectives are included, plus a link to the review and some other information.

*Suggestion 1:* 
Change the email subject to something like:
{quote}You have been invited to review <review title> (<review ID>){quote}

*Suggestion 2 (more important):* 
In the body of the email, give some basic "how to" instructions about:
* What a Crucible review is
* How to add a comment (i.e. that's basically how you do a review --- by adding comments)
* How to "complete" the review (i.e. that's just completing your bit, not the whole review)

And add a link to the User Guide for more info.

Here's a copy of the email I received recently. I was confused when I clicked the link, even though I know basically what Crucible does and have documented the IDE connectors for it!

{quote}
Subject: [CR-AG-483] You have been added as a reviewer in review...: AG-781: Audit Javadocs
From: John Kodumal <jkodumal@atlassian.com>
Date: Wed, 22 Jul 2009 14:04:55 -0700 (PDT)
To: smaddox@atlassian.com

CR-AG-483 John Kodumal says:-



---

ID: CR-AG-483 https://studio.atlassian.com/source/cru/CR-AG-483/review

Title: AG-781: Audit Javadocs

Statement of Objectives:
I think it would be beneficial to look over the generated javadocs and make sure everything is up to snuff prior to the release.

I've noticed a few places where we've refactored some method signatures and failed to keep the javadocs synced up.

State: Review

Author: John Kodumal
Moderator: John Kodumal
Reviewers: (8 active, 0 completed*)
     Sarah Maddox
     Cheryl Jerozal
     Ryan Talusan
     Ben Speakmon
     Jonathan Nolen
     Tim Moore
     Shaoting Cai
     Richard Wallace
{quote}

(i) The thing that took me the longest to figure out was how to copy text from a source code line so that I could put it into a comment.
fields.summary: Email review invitation should include basic "how to" instructions
